DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What can you tell me about Acadia?
RESPONSE TEXT: It's smaller than I'd like it to be, but then... we don't exactly have the numbers to fill someplace larger.
Makes it easier to defend, anyway. Forget it. Did you want something, or not?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What can you tell me about Acadia?
RESPONSE TEXT: I guess there's no harm in talking about it. I escaped the Institute, found the Railroad. They agreed to help get me out of the Commonwealth.
Institute tracked them down, and slaughtered them all. Far as I know, I'm the only one who got away.
So, I'm here to make sure it wasn't all for nothing.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What can you tell me about Acadia?
RESPONSE TEXT: I... I don't like talking about it. I made it to Acadia, that's what matters. Now that I'm here I'm going to make sure nothing happens to it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll probably be leaving soon.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's for the best.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: Acadia is only as secure as we make it. We take unnecessary risks, we get careless, and things can go bad. Fast.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That's a little rude, don't you think? Treat all your guests like this?
RESPONSE TEXT: No. We don't have "guests."
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: Acadia is only as secure as we make it. We take unnecessary risks, we get careless, and things can go bad. Fast.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Gosh, after a weclome this warm, who wouldn't want to just stay forever?
RESPONSE TEXT: This place isn't for you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: Acadia is only as secure as we make it. We take unnecessary risks, we get careless, and things can go bad. Fast.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Is there a problem with my being here?
RESPONSE TEXT: Maybe, maybe not.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That's for the best.
RESPONSE TEXT: Acadia is only as secure as we make it. We take unnecessary risks, we get careless, and things can go bad. Fast.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: If there's a synth who needs a safe place, then we take them in. Let them live as a synth, without fear. You don't fit that description.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Dejen: Acadia is only as secure as we make it. We take unnecessary risks, we get careless, and things can go bad. Fast.
RESPONSE TEXT: If there's a synth who needs a safe place, then we take them in. Let them live as a synth, without fear. You don't fit that description.
That makes you an unnecessary risk.
It's nothing personal. Minimizing our contact with outsiders is just practical.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You can relax. I'm not a threat.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You can relax. I'm not a threat.
RESPONSE TEXT: Just don't cause any trouble.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Too bad it's not your call to make, isn't it?
RESPONSE TEXT: You're right. DiMA says you can stay, so you can stay. Doesn't mean I have to like it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You must have tons of friends with this attitude.
RESPONSE TEXT: I don't need friends.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Is there anything I can say or do to change your mind?
RESPONSE TEXT: Just don't cause any problems.
Come on!
You're not takin' me!
Ugh.
Agh.
Ungh.
Oof.
Look, if there's nothing else...
I really don't have time to just stand around like this.
....Well?
Your business is with DiMA. Talk to him.
I assume you're not planning on staying long.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll probably be leaving soon.

RESPONSE TEXT: You want to buy something, or what?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: It's regrettable, but if it came down to choosing between synths and Far Harbor, I'd side with synths every time.
Supplies will be harder to acquire now, with Far Harbor gone... but at least they can't turn on us.
I don't care what anyone says - the Children of Atom were a threat to all of us, and I'm glad they're gone.
Keep to yourself. We don't need any more trouble.
I'm trying to get something done here.
Just because DiMA trusts you, doesn't mean the rest of us do.
Acadia is all we've got. Don't ruin that.
Just because things have calmed down doesn't mean it won't start all over again. I still don't trust the Children or Far Harbor.
DiMA surrendered to Far Harbor. And they murdered him for it.
Just wanted to report that the perimeter is all clear.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: I appreciate that, Dejen, but we've talked about this. You don't need to worry.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: I appreciate that, Dejen, but we've talked about this. You don't need to worry.
RESPONSE TEXT: With all due respect, we can never be too safe.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: I suppose not. Thank you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: Your trips to Far Harbor have been uneventful, I hope?
RESPONSE TEXT: No incidents to report, ma'am.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: You don't have to call me "ma'am," Dejen. We're all friends here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: You don't have to call me "ma'am," Dejen. We're all friends here.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yes. Right. Sorry.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: It's all right. You don't have to be sorry either. Just stay safe on your trips.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: It's all right. You don't have to be sorry either. Just stay safe on your trips.
RESPONSE TEXT: Of course, ma'am. Dammit, sorry.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC03MaleDejen: I need to talk to you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Look, it's no secret that I don't exactly trust outsiders. Anyone. But... I need help. The kind of help that stays quiet.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: I have my own set of contacts, folks that warn me when things are about to go bad. And they're telling me that Chase screwed up.

RESPONSE TEXT: I know this means you putting your life in danger for me... for us. I want you to know that it's not for nothing.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Sorry, this isn't my fight.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah, that's about what I expected. Thanks for nothing.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Coursers? Wouldn't be the first time I've taken one down.

That means you're in, yeah?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll find him before he finds you. Don't worry.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That is good news.
RESPONSE TEXT: Look, you've fought one. You know how tough they are. Most of the synths here, they wouldn't have stood a chance.
Couldn't risk having him take any of us in, or even report our location.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: I know it was asking a lot. And I won't forget that you did it. If nothing else, you've earned yourself a discount. Thanks, friend.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That is good news.

Most of the synths here wouldn't be able to hold their own in a fight.
